title: Things to Do in San Francisco in May 2017
seo_title: Things to Do in San Francisco in May 2017
meta_description: With some of SF’s best weather happening in May, this month is an excellent time to get out and enjoy some of the City by the Bay’s best events.
short_description: With some of SF’s best weather happening in May, this month is an excellent time to get out and enjoy some of the City by the Bay’s best events. Here are the Stanford Court Hotel picks for what’s going on in San Francisco in May 2017.
long_description:
With some of SF’s best weather happening in May, this month is an excellent time to get out and enjoy some of the City by the Bay’s best events. Here are the Stanford Court Hotel picks for what’s going on in San Francisco in May 2017.

 

The Summer of Love Experience: Art, Fashion, and Rock ‘n’ Roll @ the de Young Museum, through August 20

In honor of the 50th Anniversary of the Summer of Love, the the de Young Museum is putting on a special exhibition with music, interactive light shows, posters, photos, and over 300 cultural artifacts. 

 

Monet, The Early Years @ the Legion of Honor, through May 29

This is the first US exhibition dedicated to Monet’s early work. See how Monet came into his own, experimenting with different techniques before finding that internationally recognized style.

 

P.J. Harvey @ The Masonic, May 9

Singer-songwriter P.J. Harvey returns to the Masonic to perform her latest album the Hope Six Demolition Problem.

 

Google I/O @ the Shoreline Amphitheater, May 17-21

The annual conference brings together developers from all over to build web, mobile, and enterprise applications.

 

Hamilton @ Orpheum Theater, through August 5, 2017

The highly-acclaimed Broadway hit makes it to the west coast for 5 months of hip-hop infused history lessons and beats you just can’t help but get down to. 

 

Bay to Breakers, May 21

One of the most San Francisco events around, this 12K race less about running and more about having fun. Dress up and get your drink on. 

 

Modest Mouse @ The Masonic, May 26

Portland natives and indie rockstars Modest Mouse stop by the Masonic to play your favorites.
